website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Dash is a fun device for tech enthusiasts looking to cram the Web into every corner of their homes, but it's not a fit for everyone.
pros: The Sony Dash delivers a personalized buffet of news, music, and video from across the Web, packed into a 7-inch touch-screen display
cons: For all its features, nothing about the Dash really stands out as a pillar function
You can't run it using batteries

customer_reviews.title: Best alarm clock ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old one that broke. It works like brand new. The only issue I had was getting the unit reset. If took Sony about 2 weeks to reset the unit so that I could register this to my account. When these were new, they cost around $150. At $40, they are the best clocks available. The time is set automatically through the Internet. You can have 4 advanced alarms that let you pick the days of the week and the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fronck

customer_reviews.title: it's buggy and flawed into being useless. It SHOULD be able to do internet radio ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2011 and it was supposed to be my alarm clock. This thing locked up and failed to wake me up so many times it's been reduced to clock duty. Simply put, it's buggy and flawed into being useless. It SHOULD be able to do internet radio as alarm, but it never works. Pandora alarm did work, but now my phone can do that, making this thing obsolete. the interface is super slow and just very badly designed, very inefficient and unintuitive. I haven't used it in so long they may have finally updated it and I would never know, but I doubt they'll ever really support these
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: So close, but no cigar. They could fix this!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget has a really, really nice Night Mode. Big, dim numbers. Great for seeing the time without your glasses. It also has a great Sleep Mode, so that you can drift off to sleep to a myriad of selections. Screeech! What? When the device exits Sleep Mode, it will not go to Night Mode. Seems intuitive enough. But it just won't. It goes to Application Mode and lights up your room like a Christmas tree. If they fixed that little programming glitch, I'd be happy and it would make a great bedside Internet clock radio. I can live without the battery, using my cellphone as a backup. THEY. NEED. TO. ADD. THIS. FEATURE.
customer_reviews.author: michael d collier

customer_reviews.title: Great Alarm Clock
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as an alarm clock for over a week now. While it wasn't the easiest to set up (requires logging into Sony.com) once it's all set up, it's very easy to use. The DASH is easily programmable for repeating alarms. You can also program it to go into night or power save mode at certain times on certain days, saving energy or going to lower light when sleeping. The Apps are sparse and don't seem updated very often. However, for things that you'll want on a wake up station (weather, news, facebook, twitter, etc.) it's easy to add and arrange to your liking. Overall a great premium alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Parrish

customer_reviews.title: The last update made a big difference!
customer_reviews.text: I liked my Dash before for what it was, a Pandora and Netflix player, picture frame, and weather station. Some of the apps are kinda nice, especially some of the ESPN ones, but nothing too exciting. THEN the last update came out and suddenly you can actually visit a web site! Some of my favorite apps, like The Onion, were only able to display the headline and first few sentences of the article. The latest update allows me to click to go to the actual site and read the whole article. What a huge improvement. The broswer is kind of clunky, but especailly for the price it is now a really nice kitchen companion.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: The Dash does have a very narrow market it will appeal to. And when you compare its feature set with other similar consumer electronics (smartphones, netbooks, tablets), it's a little pricey -- it needs to be closer to $100 to sell in volume. The big functional drawback is: No battery backup for the alarm clock (!). Sort of defeats the purpose of having an uber-alarm clock. The touch screen is resistive, not capacitive, so it requires a hard press, but that's not that big a deal. Setup was easy, and there's a nice range of chumby-supplied apps.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: If you use this product for what it was made for you'll love it. People get this item confused with a notebook or a labtop. This is for viewing or listening only. It is NOT for browsing the internet or chatting on commuinity groups. If people take the time to read what this SONY DASH is actually made for you will see that it does everything its made to do, and it does it great. Touchscreen is accurate and navigating through its menus and options are a breez. Perfect for Pandora, Netflix, and news coverage. I'm very happy with this product from SONY.
customer_reviews.author: Philly Kell

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I'm very much against having a TV in the bedroom, but when my husband is being a TV hog, I love heading to the bedroom to spend a couple of hours with my Dash watching a good movie. I love it so much I bought a second one for my kitchen. It's perfect company while I'm cooking and takes my mind off the after-dinner cleanup. I highly recommend if you have Netflix or Hulu + accounts. Wonderful clock face for overnight that's just right and not too bright. Love my Dashes! So "dash" onto the Internet and grab one...or two!
customer_reviews.author: Bettikins

customer_reviews.title: Sony Dash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could plug it in into my poolside outdoor stereo and listen to Pandora. I was concerned about my iPhone (which I was using for Pandora) being exposed to the heat and elements. The Dash works great. The screen is very nice and the unit looks high end. Cons are it takes about 2 minutes to boot up (I take it in at night) and no Sirius Radio. Bought it during the 74 buck Amazon/Woot special so well worth the price. BTW most of the apps are useless. Stick to Apple or Android if you are looking for apps -- but of course you will pay a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: C5Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm clock but spotty for streaming video
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to use as an alarm clock. She loves that she can access Pandora while getting ready for work in the morning. It's also nice to have access to Netflix, as we don't have a TV in our bedroom. However, due to excessive pauses for buffering, streaming video is pretty painful to watch. I even added a signal repeater to ensure strong Wifi, but the problem seems to be with my Dash. If Sony works out the video bugs, it would be great if they would also add more useful content like a Hulu app (not Hulu Plus) and a Grooveshark app.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device! Best alarm clock I have ever had. It does everything I need and more. In my house it also doubles and a photo frame. It will randomly display photos of all my Facebook friends posted on their accounts and randomly display photos from my Flickr account. I'm thinking of purchasing another one just to be a photo frame. I had one issues when I first set it up and found the answer on the community forums. I found Sony is quick to answer your questions and acknowledge your suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Haehn

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem but quickly solved, this thing ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: When I received the Dash it had the firmware 1.0.1111 problem, needed update but couldn't. I manually updated from Sony's site here: [...] , you must directly copy the zip file to the USB to get this to work. Download to hard drive then transfer to USB will not work! I tried that first and it wouldn't update. I requested an RMA, then tried the direct download to USB. I worked flawlessly. This new update is very good, and for the price it can't be beat. 5 stars even with the firmware issue!
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Update appears covering most of screen that you can't get rid of and when you do update device is useless. Sony says it has stopped supporting this item
customer_reviews.text: Beware this product. Update appears covering most of screen that you can't get rid of and when you do update device is useless. Sony says it has stopped supporting this item. Support said you can call and get an alarm clock .
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Everything in one package!
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Sony alarm clocks, so when I saw this, I just had to have it! It's a great all in one device. It has an alarm clock, YouTube, Kinda slow web browser, Weather, Pictures, Pandora, Slacker, and in genreal everything you can think of! I actually think this is a great idea, although it would be a perfect "Personal Internet Viewer" if it was a little bit faster and more fluent. I actually have pretty fast internet speeds (25 Mbps) so that shouldn't be a problem. All in all though, I would recomend this!
customer_reviews.author: Szymon Sikora

customer_reviews.title: Best NIghtstand Companion
customer_reviews.text: I dunno what all the negative reviews are for, I got this as a goldbox item for much cheaper then the listed price, but still for 128$ it would be worth it. You can watch amazon videos, netflix, there are so many apps. it shows the weather and time and it is so cool, plus all the apps for it are free. It is endless fun and the best thing you could have next to your bed on on you desk in your office
customer_reviews.author: Ritschi

customer_reviews.title: Greatest alarm clock, iPhone charger, Netflix viewer, and Pandora player ever.
customer_reviews.text: Have had the Dash for almost 4 years now and it's still running strong. It's been the greatest alarm clock, iPhone charger, Netflix viewer, and Pandora player ever. Sure, button presses are slow and there hasn't been a firmware update since who knows when, but it still works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eberhard

customer_reviews.title: Fun little bedside gadget
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $100 on a gold box deal. Fun little toy. Really nice alarm and bedside clock, plus it has cool stuff in addition to that. Most of the widgets are dopey, in my opinion, but I like facebook status updates, the upside-down dogs, I can has cheeseburgers, and a few other silly internet time-wasters. Plus I can listen to a podcast or Pandora if I'm in the mood. Nice. It doesn't do a lot, but it seems pretty cool to me to have a little internet portal on my bedside table that's super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Alarm Clock Plus...
customer_reviews.text: I love the Sony Dash as my new alarm clock. I don't have to worry about remembering to turn on the alarm before bed. I set my alarm for repeat alarms Monday-Friday, because the daily alarm would wake me on Weekends also. I also like being able to do a quick email check before getting up. The Facebook app is pretty great also. I purchased a 2.0 usb drive for my personal photos, and music. I don't know what else I can say. The Sony Dash is Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Dash and found it very useful. Just a few days ago, I started to get a message on it that it's not connecting to the server and it gave me a black screen. I went to the Sony website and now there is no sign of the Dash. I think they have decided to end support for this product leaving those of us who bought it with a very expensive brick. Shame on SONY!
customer_reviews.author: SabMarCam

customer_reviews.title: Worlds Best Alarm Clock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Dash on black friday for $130 on amazon. I knew going into things that I was going to use it as an alarm clock. Its not a personal internet viewer, its essentially a web connected alarm clock. If you want a personal internet viewer i recommend getting an iPad. This thing is great to have next your bed for sports scores and facebook news feeds first thing in the morning. It auto dims itself at a set time every night, has streaming internet radio, weather updates and other information that is nice to have at your finger tips first thing in the morning. I think the dash is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome until Sony released an update that removed all functionality ...
customer_reviews.text: It was awesome until Sony released an update that removed all functionality except the alarm clock function. I bought two of these and now they're pretty much useless. Sony's support sucks for nearly every product I've bought from them in the past. I have stopped purcahing Sony products and I recommend you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: MattP

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy
customer_reviews.text: Sony has dropped all support for this. Without connection to Sony,s server its useless. Clock function will not even work.
customer_reviews.author: lance

customer_reviews.title: not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: i guess i was disappointed expecting the functionality of a tablet or an ipad, but this is just a versatile alarm clock. it has some apps but nothing like a tablet. no internet browsing. anyway, it serves its purpose for me. i just wanted the ability to have a weather forecast, dual time zone, and programmable alarm clock - for staggered alarms. its nice to wake up to digital streaming music instead of an annoying siren also. the concept is nice, but the reality of the sony dash is a let down. overpriced digital alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: mt

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I wake up each morning to everything I want to know, I turn my head and there are the newsheadlines scrolling past at just the right speed, my email, the weather - I love it. It plays movies, even Netflix and Amazon. I have a portable hard drive with all my favorite movies hooked up and I can watch a film in bed with headphones and not disturb my husband. I love my Dash!!
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic idea and when SONY still updated and supported it ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic idea and when SONY still updated and supported it it was an amazing thing As of march 2016 it's been stuck on a "control panel unable to be downloaded" error message and its been rendered usless since then. It's a paperweight now..at best Screw Sony and their products. They killed Google TV as well.
customer_reviews.author: JGjr

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT! Sony has discontinued this model and offers no support for it. Mine has died as have many others. They will not stream music from the internet anymore and Sony is not the least bit interested in resolving the problem. I would avoid any Sony branded product unless you don't mind having a useless piece of electronic equipment laying around a couple of years after you buy it. I now have a very nice $150 clock on my night stand thanks to Sony!
customer_reviews.author: willobi

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the product to Sony in early Feb for replacement. The unit had stopped working. It has been over 2 months & still no unit. Each time I call, I am told that they can't contact the Loredo Repair Center. Sony use to be good, what happened? I understand things happen & sometimes products fail, but you should stand behind your product.I will never buy Sony again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The device did not work. I bought it in ...
customer_reviews.text: The device did not work. I bought it in California but I live in Mexico City. Thereis no way to retur it with my local address. I need help to return the device and have my reimbursement. Sony is not supporting the device and it is not working due a Sony license issue and support (the support web page disapeared). Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Candlui

customer_reviews.title: Sony Dash
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to replace the typical alarm clock. The Sony Dash provides you an alarm clock, weather station, internet radio player, an e-mail preview, and many other options as well. The Sony Dash provides me with the items I need currently and have been very please with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James M

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG. LOVE THIS ALARM CLOCK! It has so moony features and apps. The screen has surprisingly high resolution: photos look great. I love waking up and getting the news and weather instantly. I bought this alarm clock for $60 and it was worth every penny! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter K Boston

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for a friend who visited my home and loved it. For this model to work I had ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Dash. I bought it for a friend who visited my home and loved it. For this model to work I had to download software from Sony. Their customer service help for the Dash ''stinks'' After much searching I found the software. I realize that Sony doesn't support the Dash on line anymore, but that's no reason not to have good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Jaikaran

customer_reviews.title: Outdated and useless.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but trouble...never updates but non-op without updates. Outdated and useless.
customer_reviews.author: Rick V.

customer_reviews.title: An awesome bedside clock
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my wife and I at 99 dollars each. At that price they are great as it is really an awesome clock. While it has internet news, sports and cam feeds, it shows weather temps by the hour for as many places you set it too.It is good looking and a touch screen. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: colginman

customer_reviews.title: Alarm Clock Only
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alarm clock. Pros: Its nice to have access to weather for the week when you first wake up. Alarms are easy to use and set up. Will charge your phone via USB, Hulu, Pandora, wireless works well. Cons: Slow interface, lack of I Heart Radio, shoddy speakers, poor list of apps, the screen is bright even when in night mode. No output for external speakers, no web browsing, no battery so must be plugged in at all times, limited support for streaming specific radio stations due to the lack of browser $80 is the most I would pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jym

customer_reviews.title: Internet Viewer It Ain't!
customer_reviews.text: Thought that this thing might replace the recently canceled AT&T Home Manager, but what a disappointment. It repeatedly had trouble connecting to my home network, despite super-strong signal strength. Then when first connected, it reported that "an update is available", so after initiating update, after more than 3-hrs it was still trying! Then if it actually did connect after an hour or so of trying, one simply cannot access desired web pages, only preselected apps. So it's totally worthless as an "internet viewer". So it was then returned for refund after a few days of same connection struggles. Forget this one.
customer_reviews.author: Albertjdz

customer_reviews.title: Sony Dash
customer_reviews.text: Interesting toy. Got it on sale for $100. The best way to think of it is as a droid phone that must always be plugged into the wall. I use it for instant information: weather, news, clock, etc. Have not used it to its full potential. Took a few minutes to figure out functionality. Best bet is to set it up online via the website for the different channels and watch any videos for tips.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great, useful, helpful, always works, my favorite alarm clock
customer_reviews.author: Ron Marie

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept but poor execution.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice alarm clock with extra features that are nice when they work but to call it a "personal internet viewer" is a joke! If you buy this be prepared to reset it at least 2-3 times a day when it loses it's internet connection plus another 2-3 times on top of that for when it freezes in the middle of resetting! A big fat red reset button next to the snooze button would've been nice so resetting it wouldn't be such a pain since the only way to reset it is to unplug it! I would not recommend paying over $50.00 for this.
customer_reviews.author: Pirorin

customer_reviews.title: Do you know how I know I got the perfect christmas gift?
customer_reviews.text: because after playing around with it and seeing what it's capable of doing.....I really want one bad. If you think you're buying an ipad, you're wasting your time...you won't be able to browse the internet... I hope sony gets more apps but even if it doesn't it is a damn good product for 149$....The internet radio stations are the best freaking thing on it. I'm in love with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Smarshopper1976

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device with great features. However, according to Sony, IT'S NO LONGERNSUPPORTED!!!!!!!! I have called 18 times to Sony support, NO HELP!!!!!!!'
customer_reviews.author: Blinn

customer_reviews.title: Sony
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday! The product has most what you need from alarm to watching videos and listening to music from the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Troyce G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is SO COOL! It is the coolest alarm clock you will ever get. When you plug in the product, it will ask you what wireless internet to join, and then ask you to complete a super quick registration. Then you can add your photos, customize your apps, go on YouTube, etc. You will impress all of your friends with this awesome device!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Very simple
customer_reviews.text: Confusing at first, but once you grasp what it is and what it's uses are everything makes sense. If it wasn't a fire sale during the time, I probably wouldn't have made the plunge.
customer_reviews.author: Charlesdf23

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst SONY product i have ever purchased, it stopped working after a couple of months, horrible interface. DONT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: John Giordani

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this for BBC streaming
customer_reviews.text: I am a Brit living abroad and wanted to use this to listen to BBC radio and follow the stocks on the LSE, everything else I was preparing for would be a bonus. Unfortunately they have not found a way to stream the BBC - extensive research on the net led to nothing, and they cant show LSE share prices. I rang customer support who werent remotely interested in my queries and suggested I shouldnt have bought it!.. So i returned it. Very underwhelmed. I've not found something to replace it, but this is not something i'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: phillyt77

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Badly needed a player like the DASH. But I was very upset with his purchase. The fact is that it does not work in Brazil. Because Amazon.com is a site where buyers shop the world, there should be a warning in which countries the DASH does not work. Thus, as not used it, I can not tell if it's good or not. The point is that I have a machine here in Brazil that are a worthless piece of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Meliponicultor

customer_reviews.title: Piece of rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Piece of rubbish. Region locked and now all but discontinued. Support is non-existent. This product has made me all but hate Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mangin

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Meh, doesn't auto dim/sleep without setting up some crazy sleep schedule, pretty outdated I wouldn't recommend buying it. It was a neat idea, but just all around bad. And I really like Sony, but meh.
customer_reviews.author: meow

customer_reviews.title: Sony Dash
customer_reviews.text: You need to be aware that this thing has no battery and needs both wireless internet availability AND to be plugged in, so it's not for just using anywhere, especially at school. Having said that, for the price, this is a really great alternative to get your teen off your pc and on the dash. Has a great alarm too. My 16 year old LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa C. Scudder

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: it was doa when i received it, but i did get a quick refund
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Stroman

customer_reviews.title: Even though it's now dated I still like it and it still works
customer_reviews.text: I use it near my entry way to see the time and weather forecast. Even though it's now dated I still like it and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Luxciel

customer_reviews.title: not the greatest item
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed with this item. It is hard to push the buttons, its really slow, it tends to reboot itself at random times. The visual interface is fussy. If i was to switch from video to radio, it takes soooo long. I think the valued price should be $39.99.
customer_reviews.author: Techygirl

customer_reviews.title: Its a Fun
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice dash player and the sound of the alarm is also very loud and it helps me in waking up on time in the morning
customer_reviews.author: Vikas Jain

customer_reviews.title: A REALLY EXPENSIVE CLOCK
customer_reviews.text: The product by itself looks like a cool concept... if you don't turn it on. The functionality and touch sensitivity is very poorly made, most of the time i have to press hard or press a couple of times in order to get the input entered. The speed of the UI and loading of the app is also very slow. Pandora radio works, but drops out every once awhile. A lot of the apps are not designed for the 7" little screen as the text become so small that you can barely read. This is just another trial project from Sony these days...
customer_reviews.author: Mochi

customer_reviews.title: SLOOOOOOOOWWWWW
customer_reviews.text: This product is very slow when transitioning between apps. We bought it for our kids but when they are used to the iTouch and being to switch screen quickly while the Sony moves at a snails pace, it is going to be returned. Also, you have to keep it plugged in at ALL time to operate. There is no rechargable battery on this device. I couldn't believe they wouldn't produce a product you could walk around your house without it plugged in! In all DO NOT waste your money. Get a 7" tablet for $120 and save yourself from this dinosaur.
customer_reviews.author: FrankL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just be sure that you have a usb drive on hand when it arrives, you will need it! I would recommend this to anyone. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It has everything I like for entertainment right at my fingertips. I bring it with me on trips for my entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: jgd

customer_reviews.title: My Dash
customer_reviews.text: The Sony My Dash is a lot of fun to play with once you get it started, that is. At first, it didn't want to play with the wifi, but once adjustments were made, it worked just fine. Love the Netflix streaming and Pandora music!
customer_reviews.author: valkono

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, Netflix, Pandora, Slacker radio, Facebook pictures from my friends, news, funny pics, did you know trivias, etc etc over wireless N. If you want more functionality than this you need to get a computer and a life :) I'm getting another one for my parents anniversary soon.
customer_reviews.author: Myself

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but extremely cool!
customer_reviews.text: For those who think they'll surf the internet, don't get your hopes up. It will not. What it does do is give you a fun experience when you explore what it can do. I haven't had one problem with it. It connected to my home WiFi very quick and easy. If Sony spends more time with updates, it'll only get better. I love my Dash!
customer_reviews.author: T Alban

customer_reviews.title: great alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: bought this to surf the internet ,this is a app device ,there is no direct surfing the interenet.cool looking nicely built ,but did not stand up to my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Pereira

customer_reviews.title: crazy alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: sony has lost their minds. in the age of smart phones, ipads and ereaders they give us an alarm clock! this is nothing more than an alarm clock w/o a battery and utube. could not surf the internet freely. menus are un adjustable and difficult. this is way too much to pay for an alarm clock. i returned mine the day after i received it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Dain

customer_reviews.title: cannot connect sony dash to pandora and it doesnt register correctly to this day.
customer_reviews.text: cannot connect to pandora or register this product correctly its sickening.how many words shouldnt be the problem not being able to register this product should be of utmost more important.
customer_reviews.author: blessedbabygirl12

customer_reviews.title: backup items
customer_reviews.text: I need to put together some items just in case something bad happen within my surrounding area. Something to protect my family and move gear and food to a bug out location fast without waiting at the last second.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: SONY DASH HID-C10 INTERNET SURFING DEVICE
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS ITEM BECAUSE OF ALL THE RAVE IT WAS GETTING .... I RECIEVED IT BRAND NEW IN THE BOX FROM SONY AND ONLY TO FIND OUT I NEEDED TO UPGRADE THE SOFTWARE ... YOU HAVE TO CALL SONY'S 800 NUMBER AND GIVE THEM THE SERIAL NUMBER AND THEY GO STEP BY STEP ON WHAT TO DO ... WORKING PERFECTLY FINE
customer_reviews.author: ericmart144

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi design makes this a paperweight
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great. I was fully expecting some bugs realizing that this was a first generation product. However, the WiFi connectivity is extremely poor. The device frequently drops the connection unless it is sitting right next to your router and even then it can't connect. I have a new Cisco router that works fine with all my other wireless devices except this one. If you visit the Sony Dash user board, you will see numerous discussions about connectivity. Obviously, without WiFi this is an expensive paperweight. That is the reason mine is getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Nordic Viking

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi reception
customer_reviews.text: Picked up wifi I'm our office but not bedroom where we were going to put the Dash. It's just not that great of an item. I'm sure there are better devices out there.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Grassmann

customer_reviews.title: Tech rating only
customer_reviews.text: I want to say first that the review is soley based on the crappy technology. The idea itself is a great one and I loved it when I got it. It was compact, fit on my nightstand and had cool things. I was going to get one for my daughter's birthday and now I'm glad I didn't. This device has so many bugs in it, it is NOT WORTH the money, pain and hassle. Get a wireless tv instead. Much better! I would advise against working with Supreme Electronics at all costs. They do not uphold Amazon's rules of good business.
customer_reviews.author: mapat

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: item seemed cool but malfunctioned. it locks up regularly. dont trust it to wake you up. seller is great. fast shipping. great service. unfortunately inferior product. not reccomended
customer_reviews.author: maddmatt

customer_reviews.title: save your money
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this even after reading the reviews. Probably wasn't worth it, it's a neat concept to see those apps on a little viewer like that, too bad its a little unfriendly and on top of that you have to leave it plugged in, which is really stupid!!!!
customer_reviews.author: brooks

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE ! Outside US
customer_reviews.text: The device is designed to be used only in the US. If you want to use it in other countries it doesnt work. Here is the Sony Support link where they inform the problem: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Max Isola de Izcue

customer_reviews.title: It was terrible
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible product. I returned it immediately. You couldnt do anything with it. If you want to pay a $100.00 for an alarm clock then this is for you! Otherwise don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Akers

customer_reviews.title: A nice gadget
customer_reviews.text: It delivers in accordance with its description. A nice alarm watch with cool Internet features. I had high expectations for the touchscreen feature. Despite that, I use it on a daily basis as my wake up watch and to check the weather.
customer_reviews.author: LStorino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome now.
customer_reviews.text: With a little effort at the beginnning to make it work properly, this gadget works great at bedside for us now.
customer_reviews.author: Hênio Henrique Aragão Rêgo

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The anticipation of what could be done with this perhaps leads to greater disappointment. The device was pretty cool; bright touch screen, image flips when you rotate the device BUT this is the most difficult item to set-up that I've ever seen. My wife and I spent HOURS trying to set this thing up but to no avail. We returned it and bought an Archos7 for another 60 bucks. Best money I've ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: jbigham1

customer_reviews.title: Great little device!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Dash. I use the first one in the bedroom, mostly for its great alarm clock functions. The second is in my office as mainly a Pandora and Netflix viewer. Sony has really supported the Dash with updates often. Including substantial updates to the Netflix app.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Sony Dash - A practical device
customer_reviews.text: It is a practical device. It is not a tablet but it has interesting things. I consider that it needs to him to be able to tune radio FM.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: DASH
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool, lots of neat apps. I wanted more alarms and clock settings since that was my reason for getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele D. Lantz

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for a Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work primarily for Pandora Internet Radio, most of the apps are gimicky and won't hold your attention very long. The Apps for Internet camera locations works well but the news apps just give you a tidbit of informnation that you cannot expand and or go to site to see the full story. As for Pandora, it does a fair job of playback but at least once a day it crashes and has to reboot and or kicks you out of Pandora. Would be better off getting a dedicated Internet Radio/Pandora device. For apps and pictures viewing get a laptop or use your smartphone..
customer_reviews.author: Goroad1

customer_reviews.title: great concept, poorly created product
customer_reviews.text: After hundreds of online purchases, this is the first review I've written. I loved the idea of the internet based alarm clock, but the product is complex and the user interface is very poorly designed. The apps are far too limited, and the clunky to use. The product failed after 38 days and Amazon and Woot (the seller) said tough luck. Sony is going to replace it with a remanufactured unit, but I have to pay shipping. Save your money, this product isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: junk literally throwing it away because it won't work. ...
customer_reviews.text: junk literally throwing it away because it won't work... google "sony dash problem"
customer_reviews.author: Chappyv

customer_reviews.title: Stop working out of know where I still have hopefully ...
customer_reviews.text: Stop working out of know where I still have hopefully Sony will get things together and update the software
customer_reviews.author: Coach T5

customer_reviews.title: It definitely is not anywhere near the category of a tablet - much more like an alarm clock with limited streaming capabilities
customer_reviews.text: The device is very laggy and I believe Sony has dropped it from support some time ago. That said, it did work ok for streaming music and watching netflix. It definitely is not anywhere near the category of a tablet - much more like an alarm clock with limited streaming capabilities. If used for that purpose it was OK. The wedge shape was nice for placing it on a nightstand.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C.

customer_reviews.title: Network Error
customer_reviews.text: the dash I had for like 5 years all of a sudden just stopped working (network error) so I bought this brand new one to replace it... plugged it in...set it up and boom... Network Error. Waste of Money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: even though it is now discontinued by sony I like it and use it every day
customer_reviews.author: Jfields

customer_reviews.title: slow
customer_reviews.text: Great alarm clock but its really slow in comparison to a tablet for similar uses. Very cool item to show off to your friends though. Also like the variety of tones to wake you up.
customer_reviews.author: stephen tart

customer_reviews.title: specific uses only
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a bedside internet radio for my 5 year old. Wouldn't recommend it for many other uses, though. You can easily find a more well-functioning tablet that you can unplug...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schwartzenburg

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work must be why they stopped making them!
customer_reviews.text: AFTER SEVERAL ATTEMPS WITH SONY ON-LINE COULD NEVER GET TO WORK FINALLY GAVE UP AND SENT IT BACK., FIRST SONY PRODUCT THAT I THOUGHT WAS JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: G. L. Rike

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Set up options. Plenty of personal options that make the unit functional and fun to have as daily informative wake up.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Eichholz

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted the coolest alarm clock...but...
customer_reviews.text: It is an OK gizmo...I really wanted it to replace my alarm clock, but without a battery backup and the fact that without an internet connection, it goes dark; it was a horrible choice. Now all it does is look at me in the kitchen with whatever stupid little app is running...
customer_reviews.author: BIGGY

customer_reviews.title: Great Netflix, Pandora and Internet radio player
customer_reviews.text: This is now my 3rd Sony Dash HID-C10. I got one at work, one in my kitchen and one next to my bed. I use it to for Netflix, Pandora, and Internet radio. It is great at doing that. I looked at the successor, but it doesn't support any video. I bought all my HID-C10 refurbished or used, paid between $55 to $70 for them. For that price it's great. Also my 4 year old loves to watch kids shows on Netflix on the Dash. Get the first generation Sony Dash for full functionality. Yes it is not mobile and it is not a tablet, but for what I do with it it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the hyped product they made it to be.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed - better off with an iPad or other tablet on a stand next to the bed than with this....so sad....so much potential - still needs a lot of work!
customer_reviews.author: H.A.Bustos

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I knew when I bought this that it was going to be my glorified alarm clock. And as such, I'm quite impressed (besides the fact that for some reason there is no buzzer alarm sound). It does play videos from youtube quite impressively. A lot of the features are kinda slow and tedious, what do you expect for $100 though. The reason I bought this was to play my extensive music selection from my wd passport hard drive, and it does do that. Accessing some of the bands takes some time though, this machine is not a powerhouse by any means. It does its function, and as such, I am happy, especially considering what I paid, not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: 30volts

customer_reviews.title: Alarm clock 2.0.  Not a wireless tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This item replaced my alarm clock and allows me to wake up to the sounds of waves crashing on the shore. Once I'm wary of my surroundings I can then view the weather with a glance. There are plenty of apps and if this was used in my kitchen I would download Netflix. My biggest complaint is that there is not a battery backup, risky as an alarm clock. Easy to set up but like many app devices you have to sift through the endless garbage to find apps worth using. 1/4 the cost of a tablet but limited by a powercord.
customer_reviews.author: Buyn It

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to set up and works well in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I love having this set up in my kitchen.... Its great for just the weather conditions alone. It works as my radio and my way of keeping up to date when I'm slaving in the kitchen and I don't even need to look or be outside to know the current weather conditions. My unit updated automactically when network was set up and setup was a breeze. I'm not sure this is the best thing for browsing the internet but its not why I purchases this anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Shadz6

customer_reviews.title: Save the box and be prepared to pay your own shipping for repairs
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my fiances birthday but ended up giving it to my daughter (her birthday is a month later) I never turned it on until last week. It worked for 2 days and then would not turn on. It's too late now to return it to Amazon. SONY has a lousy policy where it has to be sent in (at my expense) for repairs. I thought better of SONY than that; but won't make the same mistake again. You shouldn't either. Don't waste your money on SONY products, their own company does not support them!
customer_reviews.author: Hatti

customer_reviews.title: alarm clock on steroids
customer_reviews.text: Had the device for a couple of weeks. The good: easy to configure, easy to use; easy to upgrade the firmware. the bad: no 220v support (i'm not from the USA), looses network connection; requires restart every couple of days. A great bedside devide: very clear clock; easy to use alarm clock; serves nice as a web photo album watching application and internet radio player; weather updates available. But it is miles away from being a tablet; not rich enough applications; no UTF support for non-english letters; not enough preconfigured radio stations (and i still didn't manage to add my own).
customer_reviews.author: gidi

customer_reviews.title: Simple app interface
customer_reviews.text: Overall I was impressed. Easy to use setup as a bedside entertainment and alarm clock. Requires PC to activate app accounts for netflix, hulu+, and facebook. Nice screen but needs cleaning often from smudge marks. PC interface to setup apps automatically updates the Dash. Good variety with 3 channel setups for custom app catalogs. Drawback is the inability to customize the music and video menu's for simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: this is fraud, it can only be used in the U.S. and Canada, not in other countries, it is to watch one, I lost my money
customer_reviews.author: Francisco A. Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: cool gadget
customer_reviews.text: nice addition to your desk or bedside table. streams netflix nicely with a surprisingly great picture.gets internet radio with no problems, plenty of calendars and alarms, flickr and even a nav. system. im thinking about putting one in every room. the only drawback are most of the apps are kinda beginner-ish. sony could do alot better, more professional. these apps look like a 10 year old put them together. i still give it 5 stars (its that good), hopefully sony will step up the quality of the apps
customer_reviews.author: nocoredneck

product_meta.title: Sony HIDC10 Dash Personal Internet Viewer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingYour favorite parts of the Internet customized the way you choose, available in a dash. Over 1,000 free apps can be displayed at the touch of a finger. Choose from your favorite information and entertainment content including weather, traffic, social networking, movies, music and more pushed right to your kitchen, bedroom, or office. The Dash Personal Internet Viewer connects quickly and easily to your existing wireless network and features a vibrant 7-inch LCD touchscreen for accessing a variety of video services for online music and viral videos, full-length feature movies and TV shows. You can also listen to MP3s and Internet radio via the built-in stereo speakers, or by using the headphone jack (headphones not included).

AMAZON.COM
Your favorite parts of the Internet customized the way you choose, available in a dash. Over 1,000 free apps can be displayed at the touch of a finger. Choose from your favorite information and entertainment content including weather, traffic, social networking, movies, music and more--pushed right to your kitchen, bedroom, or office. The Dash Personal Internet Viewer connects quickly and easily to your existing wireless network and features a vibrant 7-inch LCD touchscreen for accessing a variety of video services for online music and viral videos, full-length feature movies and TV shows. You can also listen to MP3s and Internet radio via the built-in stereo speakers, or by using the headphone jack (headphones not included).

Make the Internet uniquely yours and access over 1,500 free apps with the Dash Personal Internet Viewer. Click to enlarge. 

The compact size maximizes counter, bedside, and desktop spaces. 

Access a variety of video services for online music and viral videos, full-length feature movies and TV shows. 

Your favorite parts of the Internet customized the way you choose, available in a dash. 

Streamline Your Life with Free Apps
The 1500-plus apps available for the Dash Personal Internet Viewer deliver the information and entertainment you want--weather, traffic, social networking, movies, music, and more--right to your kitchen, bedroom, or office. 

Listen to What You Want
The Dash Personal Internet Viewer is a compact audio multi-tool: listen to MP3s and Internet Radio out loud with the built-in stereo speakers, or privately by using the headphone jack (headphones not included). 

Customization
Customizing the Dash home screen to fit your own personal needs and style is easy. Simply choose your favorite apps and theme that you want displayed. 

Access to Sony Content
Get access to the best Sony has to offer: movie trailers, minisodes, music videos, game trailers, and the latest deals from SonyStyle.com. 

7-Inch LCD Touchscreen
The WVGA 800x480 LCD touchscreen displays crystal clear photos and video from a wide viewing angle, and automatically adjusts the display for an upright or horizontal orientation. 

Simple Setup
Connect quickly and easily to your existing wireless network. 

Elegant and Space Saving Design
The compact size maximizes counter, bedside, and desktop spaces, and the timeless design blends in with any décor. 

Easy-to-Use Clock and Alarms
When you enter your zip code the device automatically sets the time for you. Set up custom alarms, either one-time or recurring, with the option of waking to Internet radio stations, built-in alarm sounds, or your favorite app.5 

Multi-Source Video Content
Access a variety of video services for online music and viral videos, full-length feature movies and TV shows you can watch and control on the brilliant LCD. 

Convenience
Stream the web content you specify through Internet apps, without the distraction of a PC. It's always on, always fresh, always available at a glance without the delay of booting up your PC. 

Online Photo Access and Sharing
For a great photo viewing experience the Dash Personal Internet Viewer conveniently loads and displays your photos from online services such as Photobucket, or you can simply view your photos directly via USB. The touchscreen user interface allows you to set effects, rotate photos, zoom, and play or pause photo slide shows. 

USB 2.0 Interface
Access audio, video or photo content stored on mass storage USB devices by connecting to the USB port. 

What's in the Box
Sony Dash Personal Internet Viewer and user's manual.
feature_bullets: Get information and entertainment in your bedroom, kitchen, or office, without being tethered to your PC
1,500+ apps available to deliver weather, traffic, social networking, movies, music, and more
7-inch touchscreen with gesture support and WVGA (800x480) pixel resolution
802.11b/g Wi-Fi to easily connect to your wireless home network
500Mhz processor with 32kB I/D L2 cache; 256 MB, 667MHz DDR2 DRAM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars425 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
